results.title: Mrs Brown = Her Majesty Mrs Brown (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Madden, Sarah Curtis, Ecosse Films, Mobil Masterpiece Theatre, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description: Set at the height of Victorian England, ‘Mrs Brown’ tells of the extraordinary relationship between a Queen and a commoner. Judi Dench gives a stunning performance (which was reflected by her Best Actress nomination), as Queen Victoria who begins a doomed, and ultimately tragic relationship with her servant, John Brown (Billy Connolly). Brown brings comfort and life to the Queen’s long period of mourning following the death of her husband, Albert. Where others failed to cheer her up, Brown succeeds, and in doing so secures the Queen’s respect and friendship. The Victorian court is suspicious of their leader’s new found happiness which forces the Queen and Brown to make some painful choices about their relationship, their own needs, and the monarchy. Cast includes Antony Sher, Geoffrey Palmer, Richard Pasco and David Westhead.

results.title: Mrs and Mr Peacock
results.creator_credit: Kantital Rathod, C. George Chaput and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An example of child art. Nine-year-old Susan Elain Chaput wrote this story, drew the pictures and narrated the commentary. Tells with insight and humour, the story of Mr and Mrs Peacock, who live in the town of Onion, near a beautiful park called Me-Oh-My.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kantital Rathod, C. George Chaput and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
results.brief_description: James Stewart stars as naive young Jefferson Smith, the well-loved head of a chain of boys’ clubs, who is unwittingly set up by a group of unscrupulous politicians and sent to Washington as a Senator. He is expected to vote as the party machine dictates and so ease the passage of a fraudulent Bill. Jeff discovers the double-deal and the normally mild mannered good guy turns into a veritable “house on fire” to attack the web of corruption that surrounds him.

results.title: Mr. Rossi on the beach
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto and Bruno Bozzetto Films
results.brief_description: An animated film which traces the misadventures of Mr Rossi savouring the pleasures of a seaside resort - the sand and the sea, the good food, the pretty girls. Since Mr Rossi is not easily discouraged, there are countless funny moments before we leave him bravely battling a midnight mosquito. Animation by Franco Martelli.

results.title: Mr. Rossi in Venice
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto and Bruno Bozzetto Films
results.brief_description: Mr Rossi finds himself in Venice - not the Venice of postcards, but of polluted canals, rotten buildings, and overcrowded steamboats. Eager to impress a pretty tourist, Mr Rossi takes up the fight against the disease that is destroying the city. But it is like tilting a windmill. Mr Rosi is defeated before an enemy too big to conquer - pollution. Animation by Giorgio Valenti.

results.title: Mr. Rossi goes camping
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto and Bruno Bozzetto Films
results.brief_description: Mr Rossi’s search for a peaceful camping site leads him into hilarious encounters with bulldozers, cows and mountain-climbing motorcycles. Though not a “message” film, along with the laughter the real ecological problems come through. An animated film.

results.title: Mr. Robot
results.brief_description: A young programmer, Elliot, suffers from a debilitating anti-social disorder and finds himself in the intersection between the cybersecurity firm he works for and the underworld organisations bringing down corporate America.

constellations_other.name: Hack the planet
constellations_other.description: How do you represent something that's... kinda boring to look at, like hacking, when you're operating in a visual medium like film, TV and videogames?

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

constellations_other.name: Freedom from surveillance
constellations_other.description: Real world and cinematic authoritarianism and resistance explored through documentaries, Hollywood blockbusters, TV and videogames.

results.description: A contemporary and culturally resonant drama about a young programmer, Elliot, who suffers from a debilitating anti-social disorder and decides that he can only connect to people by hacking them. He wields his skills as a weapon to protect the people that he cares about. Elliot will find himself in the intersection between a cybersecurity firm he works for and the underworld organizations that are recruiting him to bring down corporate America.
description_for_label: A contemporary and culturally resonant drama about a young programmer, Elliot, who suffers from a debilitating anti-social disorder and decides that he can only connect to people by hacking them. He wields his skills as a weapon to protect the people that he cares about. Elliot will find himself in the intersection between a cybersecurity firm he works for and the underworld organizations that are recruiting him to bring down corporate America.

results.title: Mr. Neal Is Entitled to Be an Agitator
results.creator_credit: Daryl Dellora, Sue Maslin and Film Art Doco Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: This film takes its title from the judgement handed down by Lionel Murphy in favour of a Queensland Aboriginal activist. Judge Lionel Murphy (1922-1986), noted for legal reforms such as the Family Law Act and Trade Practices Act, was the most senior judicial figure in the modern history of the Commonwealth to be charged with a criminal offence. The film examines the events surrounding this controversial case with Murphy battling to retain his position on the High Court during the last years of his life. In a wider sense, the film considers some of the more fundamental issues about Australian law, the role of the police and security and surveillance in Australia.
